text: The food was amazing. It was something new that I had never tried before. The taste was authentic and homemade. Other then the taste of the food the most compelling aspect was the friendly waiter. She was very kind and enlighten.
A very good place to have coffee lunch or dinner. The atmosphere is contemporary and clean the staff freindly and the food is delicious.

I didn't want to give a star rating because I walked out. It appears smoking is ok at this restaurant and I just don't like to go to places where I have to breathe someone's cigarette smoke, however little. As Justice Holmes once wrote, a smoker and non-smoker cannot be equally free in a railway car.

Excellent food. Horrible service. Literally children running around between the bar and restaurant areas for 15 minutes. Something had to be said for the manager to come out and say something. Waitress wasn't rude, but very short and slow. 15 minutes to take the order, when they weren't busy, then stood around socializing while I waited for the check. It took another waitress to come by to offer it, when ours was finally prompted to do so by her. My meal was served 10 minutes before my friends was ....

I absolutely loved this place. I was so impressed by the food here. I got the shopska and chicken kebab the last time I ate here and it was really fresh and so delicious. Plus, the staff here are extremely friendly. I also really enjoyed the atmosphere inside. Its very pleasant. I would like to come back sometime for a drink with friends. Its close to where I work, so I will definitely be coming back again and again!
The food was great,  the service was excellent. Thank you for bringing me back in memories with delicious meals.  Highly recommended!

It was our first dining experience here, and my first experience with European food, our server Maia was so awesome and very helpful. Great service, good food, good desserts! Will definitely come again.
HVALA!
Authentic Bulgarian Food!! Enjoyed every bite! Staff was very friendly! We will come back again!

Very good food, very good service. The portions were so big i and my husband really could not finish. I would of give it 5* but i've seen dishes comeing out if the kitchen that you couldn't find on the menu .. So,as an idea, update your Menus so you can sell what you serve :))
Authentic, amazing. You should try the biscuit cake and the cappuccino. Also kebapche or the mixed grill. very nice service and the food is home made.

My dear friend and I came here for a girls' night out, and it was awesome.  We were not familiar with pretty much everything on the menu, but that didn't matter in the least.  We followed the advice of yelpers and of our helpful server, ordered a ton of food, and it all was delicious!!  We got the potato and ham dish, and it really was one of the best things I've ever eaten.  The potatoes were so fluffy, and the dish was seasoned perfectly.  The ham wasn't even necessary, but was a nice touch.  There was no rush to leave; we sat and talked and savored each dish.  You know how you can get so full, but you want to keep eating because everything is so delicious?  That's how we were.  We were painfully full by the time we left, with lots of food to take home, and yet the price was quite reasonable.  I am excited to try other dishes here, and want to bring my husband and children.

First let me start off that this is a Bulgarian restaurant and not Medditteranian. The food was pretty good until later that night i discovered I had food poisoning and vomited my life away. I had all the symptoms of food poisoning and almost went to the ER. Never again will I even drive by this place.

As far as the service, our server was a Bulgarian woman who wasn't that pleasant. You can tell she wanted us out of there fast. What surprised me was that when she ordered our drinks she asked us if we can wait for it cuz she wanted to smoke a cigarette first lol unbelievable.
Great service and even better food. Had kebabcheta with Shopska salad and rosted red peppers salad. This is what home tastes like!

Amazing cuisine, the zucchini with garlic yogurt sauce are must try. The chicken soup is perfect choice to start paired with the Snow White salad ( snezanka) . Then if you can't make your mind get the mixed grill it has everything  and you will be surprised by the amount of different flavors and spices. For the end strongly recommend the biscuit cake. I can't get enough of this place, can't wait for next time !!!!

my friend is very Bulgarian and he hunted down a place to take us while in town. He was very impressed with its authenticity and spoke with the waitress for about 30 min until he was too drunk to speak in proper Bulgarian any longer.

Loved it.

This was my first time here and I took my family along.  We had karnache plate and kebapcheta plate. My hubby had tripe soup. The food was delicious. The Bulgarian cheese on top of the fries was heavenly tasty (much better quality than any Greek cheese I ever had). The ambience was modern and fun. Very clean too. The service was great and everyone was very friendly. You feel right at home and welcomed even if you have never been there before. I would highly recommend this place with authentic Bulgarian food and friendly staff.
One of my favorite places in town.  The cuisine may not be for everyone, but the quality and cost are great!
Outstanding! Great authentic Bulgarian food,big variety,affordable prices!The owner and the staff are really friendly! Absolutely loved this place!

Wish I could give this place 5 stars. But I have a mixed review based on my experience. My waitress kardashian (actual name Ana?) was very nice and good. We also met the owner, nice guy. I took my family here and a girl server(name will later be posted) who wasn't even our server. Saw my girlfriend eating her vegetables she had brought in a small bag from home and immediately rushed over to let us know that that wasn't ok and that she had to order something, even though she did order beer. (We understood this considering it's not normal to bring out side food to restaurants.) My girlfriend has severe food allergies that's why we did that. But we were willing to order an extra plate to accommodate the server whom was upset with the situation. But considering we had four other people in our party ordering full meals, the owner was very nice about it and said it was ok. After telling her we were ok with paying for a plate for the person not eating she started getting mouthy and raised her voice. THE PROFESSIONAL WAY OF HANDLING THE SITUATION WOULD HAVE BEEN TO ASK THE OWNER/ MANAGER IF IT WAS OK BEFORE CONFRONTING US AND GIVING US CRAP. When in the end the owner said it was ok for her to eat her food from home at the table.
My girl explained to me that she had actually worked with this girl (the server who wasn't actually our server) at another restaurant before and they never got along. I personally feel victimized by this girl confronting us before talking with her manager. She bothered me and my family for no reason! SHE SHOULDN'T BE BRINGING HER PROBLEMS FROM OUTSIDE OF WORK INTO WORK. AND BOTHERING ME AND MY FAMILY WHILE WE ARE TRYING TO EAT. BEFORE AND AFTER SHE WOULDN'T STOP GIVING US THE DIRTIEST LOOKS! We weren't even bothering her nor looking at her in the first place! They need someone more professional and stable who won't be treating customers like this. IF I DECIDE TO COME BACK: will only be because of the courtesy of the owner and our server kardashian. And of course the good food! I also liked the decor, and chill music. We let the situation go and ended up having a great time but that girl defiantly should be coached by the owners and management that you don't bring outside problems into work and handle situations of question like that (you ask a manager first before creating a situation of tension! . Coming from a fellow manager.

We were in the area looking for a great new place to try and once again Yelp leads us to a winner.  BG Bistro is probably the best Bulgarian restaurant we've ever been to being that it's the only one we've ever been to. Had no idea what to expect as far as taste but on the wall there was a huge map Bulgaria was right next to Greece and Turkey so I kind of had something to base my expectations on.

The staff was super nice especially Neli our server. We went with all of her recommendations and loved all of them. Here's what we got:

- Chicken Soup: Homey, simple and lots of flavor. Most importantly the chicken was tender.
- Kashkaval Pane: Basically a fried cheese patty that was delicious. Served with a side of fries with feta on top - yum
- Mixed Grill:  Yelpers suggested going with this entree if you couldn't decide on which meat to get.  They were all delicious and to our surprise all pork which was a bonus because my wife doesn't eat beef. If I had to choose my favorite off of the whole plate though it would be the Kiufteta.

My wife and I shared all this and still had enough to save for lunch the next day.  Total bill was $30 including tip which was a great deal. We'll definitely be back.

Our only main complaint was that they allow smoking at the bar which caries over into the dining room but Neli made every attempt to shield us from the smoke by closing the dividers and such so I can't knock them for that.

Final note, about 10 minutes into our meal we noticed that all the music being played was Michael Bolton. We asked Neli if Michael Bolton was the David Hasselhoff of Bulgaria but she said that the owner just wanted to play something calm. We had no idea he had so many hits that we knew and it was hilarious to see fellow diners humming and singing along as we ate.
Nelly is fantastic the waitress the food was great. The flavor was full of zing.  Nelly even gave us free cake!  Whatever the cake that looks like cinammon but tastes like yummy get it.

This restaurant is absolutely perfect for a fun date or a simple girls night out. Our  server was Annie, an incredibly gorgeous and very polite young woman. She was very attentive and helpful with our food choices since this was our first time eating Bulgarian food. The food was very tasty and light. You can taste the freshness and you are not left to feel bloated because the  dishes and sides have very few and all natural ingredients.  The ambiance is a winner! Its fun, upbeat yet not over-saturating/overwhelming.  Great semi-loud music, very dim lighting,  and a great choice of decor (reds, golds, browns,  and white). I will definitely be coming back here many times again.

My husband & I saw this restaurant several times as we left Smiths on Tropicana, so we decided to try it... It was ALL excellent, the food the service and the price.  They let us sample the specials to help us decide what we wanted. It reminded me of delicious home cooking.  Highly recommend.
Great Bulgarian food. Fantastic whole fish. Ambiance just ok. Service good. Has some greek dishes. I ate there about 4 times and the food was great every time.
Very delicious food! I would definitely be back next time I am in Vegas. Everything we tried was great! From the soups, to the salads to the main dishes!
Such a nice place !!! The food is delicious and everyone is very friendly!!!  This is must  try place in Vegas if you want to try traditional Bulgarian food !!!
The best place for coffee with friends..i go there every day... the food is also so delicious...

What an amazing surprise! My friends suggested BG Bistro so I had to check it out. Wow, from the service to to food it was way beyond my expectations. Flavor, freshness and price point all 5 star. I had the arugula salad and lamb chops. They start you off with delicious bread and butter as well. Highly recommend and I will be here often.

Wow! I loved BG Bistro in every way including the "Nu Pagadi" cartoons from my childhood constantly playing on the two TV screens. I was greeted in Bulgarian and felt immediately at home. 

The food menu is short and simple and every item looked delicious. I could have easily closed my eyes, pointed my finger on the menu and would have been pleased with whatever it landed on. My party ordered tarator(cold cucumber soup), shopska salad, chuski buirek, kiufteta with cabbage and luteniza, kavarma, palachinki and espresso. Everything was excellent and home cooked. The tarator was my favorite. The owner came to the table to check on us and our waitress was very friendly and attentive. The prices are very reasonable and the portions are generous.

They have done an excellent job at splitting the restaurant in a smoking and non-smoking section. I loved, loved, loved the Bulgarian themed pictures especially with our national hero Vasil Levski and the sacred world famous Rila monastery. I am so proud to be Bulgarian!!! Thank you for this authentic Bulgarian experience. I feel less homesick now.

I will definitely visit this restaurant every time I come to Las Vegas! Bravo! Hvala! Blagodarya!
Awesome place for delicious Eastern European cosine. The staff is very friendly and the prices are more than reasonable. All the things you can ask for.

Great bang for the buck. 
Wanted Mediterranean 
Got Mediterranean. 
Fantastic salads
My lamb chops were perfectly cooked , very flavorful , light on the spice on a bed of dilled potatoes and shrooms. 

Spouse had a pork sausage dinner. 
Home made?  Very light and juicy. 

Beer cold. 
Service fast. 

We were about to walk out of the place when we arrived.  The main entrance takes you into the main bar, eat, ambiance, tv area.  Smelled like smoke. 
It's the smoking section. 

We allowed ourselves to be corralled to a separate non smoking section. The ambiance in the area is a big zero. It ducks  that  the  smokers get he cool bar main eating awesome ambiance area. 

Non smokers.  You're shuffled to the weird , sparsely decorated after thought of a room. 
70's disco  doesn't fit 

As unusual and unappealing the ambiance is in the non smoking section , I'll. Be back. 

Very good food 
Very good price. 
Very good service. " elitsa"


--------
2 days later. 

Couldn't stay away. 
Came back for more perfectly cooked flavorful chunks of lamb and pork. 
We took a two day supply of baklava home with us. 
Holy Moses is it good. It's not dry like mist I've had. 
It's juicy and packed ( PACKED) with walnuts and traditional oil.  

I received , once again, excellent service. 
I particularly liked how the staff noticed us leaving and sent us off with a genuine appreciative thanks

Thanks  .
-------
Several visits later. 

Got 6 baklava to go. 
Gonna give some away as gifts. 

Yup. It's that good.

-----------
Stopped by last night for baklava to go. Yum. 
----------
4-17-18 
My stomach is so happy. 
I had the lamb 
Wife had a great sausage , we got baklava to go. 
Gonna use that juicy baklava as an aphrodisiac later. ......  yup. It's that good guys!

Yoana!
Fantastic wait staff. She 
Clearly takes ownership and pride of the establishment, is proud to be part of the owners Bulgarian creation. 
She engaged in some polite table chit chat and shared some of her personality with us. 

I always appreciate that in a server if it isn't busy.

Thanks o ye Bulgarian boys-n-babs 
For providing a NON American 
Most excellent 
Culinary experience!

Great place, authentic and delicious Bulgarian food!! 
I also love that the place is separated in 2 rooms - a smoking and nonsmoking one. I make sure I come visit the place every time I'm in Vegas! The food choice is also amazing! I came with a couple of my friends and one of the girls was vegan and the other one was vegetarian. They were very happy that they had choices and loved the place too.

First off I would like to say that I have absolutely no experience in Bulgarian cuisine. However, everything I tasted here was good so five stars haha.
A Bulgarian friend of mine actually took us here for dinner. It was crowded and seemed like a regulars type of place. The waitress was very nice and took the time to explain the menu to us. My friend actually ended up ordering for us so I just went with it.

Here's a list of what we got:

-Fried cheese: Okay so you're probably thinking 'what the heck? fried cheese?!' yes fried cheese. Not sure what type of cheese they used but it was very light and not overly ooey gooey like a mozzarella stick. This dish grew on me.

- Lamb soup & cucumber soup: If you're going to opt for a soup, I would go with the cucumber soup. It's a cold soup so it was very light and refreshing. Had bits of cucumber, yogurt?, and some herbs. No clue what herbs but it tasted good. 

- Bulgarian sausage: Excellent also. No idea what spices were in the sausage but it was very savory and paired well with the potato wedges.

Very vague review but all I can say is that this place serves up great food, good service, all at a great price.

We wanted to try someplace different, and BG Bistro definitely didn't disappoint. We came on a Wednesday evening and they had live music. The servers were very friendly and the owner came up and introduced himself and sat down with us for a little while. We had the sampler appetizer, which was very good and then split a sausage platter (yum) and Pork Kavarma. Both were very delicious and were definitely homemade. We ordered Baklava for dessert, and then the server brought us another Bulgarian dessert she insisted that we try. We'll definitely be back!

Most amazing Eastern European food outside of Eastern Europe!!! As a picky Romanian who has very high standards for Eastern European food, I did not have high expectations when we stumbled upon this Las Vegas gem - I'm glad I was proven wrong! We were two Romanians and one American and all agreed that BGBistro was one of the Best restaurants we have EVER been to!  First of all, we walked in on a busy March 8th evening that normally required reservations in advance but the manager/owner ? kindly accommodated us. The waitress was so warm and friendly and the entire restaurant checked on us and waited on us to ensure we had a great meal. For appetizers we ordered : Russian salad, Sautéed Mushrooms, Eggplant salad and Captese salad - all delicious !! For our entrees we ordered: the Beef Steak , Pork Stew, and of course Mititei - all phenomenal ! For desert we had two cakes made in house that were very delicious. Additionally the prices were very reasonable and the drinks were great. I honestly give the absolute highest recommendations to this restaurant and cannot wait to go to Vegas and visit it again. We all agreed that it was one of the best restaurant we have ever been to and it made our Vegas experience better ! Lastly, it is close to the strip! Excellent service and amazing food !

Bulgarian food for the win! Don't let the sketchy plaza turn you off, the interior is upscale and cozy and the food is delicious. If you don't know where to start with the menu, order the Mixed Grill Plate and the Shopska salad- for under $25, it's enough for two to share for a meal and still not finish it all. 

Plate has four different meats (the skewer was my favorite), three side salads (potato, bean, and cabbage), and a house bread. The salad is huge and covered in delicious Bulgarian feta cheese. Could use more olives and onions, was mostly tomato and cucumber but very tasty.

I have been to BG'S Bistro a few times and they have catered meetings for me as well.  It has always been an excelent service and experience.  Thanks to all the staff that works there for making us feel at home.

Just had a lunch date with my mom at BG Bistro. The atmosphere was pleasant. They offer a bar/smoking area that is completely separate from the nonsmoking area. It was my first time experiencing European food and our server Elitsa was more than willing to explain the different options. They offer al la carte so you can sample a little bit of everything. The kiufteta and sauteed potatoes are to die for as well as the lamb cops. Great prices and portion sizes. We left with enough left overs to hold me over for the next couple of days. I posted a couple photos on snapchat so they will be seeing more of me in the future while I bring all my friends and family to try it out.

I came here to meet up with a Bulgarian friend and I know I will be coming back. I tried some rakia (a kind of brandy) and some Bulgarian beer. Both were tasty and inexpensive. I Ordered the butter tripe which was fantastic and the portions were decent as well. I liked how the menu has pictures of the food to help people who aren't familiar with Bulgarian cuisine and the daily specials are prepared fresh daily.

Really love this place. Its very authentic and serves wonderful Bulgarian food at an incredible price. They always have specials also and plenty of vegetarian dishes. We would go here more often - but its too smokey.

I came here with my Bulgarian friend, go figure ha! The place is small and quaint, it's so culturally unique because they'll have karaoke nights in which you can catch live Bulgarian music. The staff are all sweet beautiful Bulgarian ladies, that's definitely a plus lol. Let's be honest, I came here for their imported 'Kamenitza' beer, it's a must order if you go here. Also, their fries with shredded goat cheese is amazing!

This is what you call a hidden gem. I'm new to trying Eastern European food, but it is definitely amazing. I like that the restaurant and bar are separated. I tried it with my boyfriend and we started with some kind of fried cheese with fries as an appetizer. It was surprisingly not as heavy as I expected which is a good thing. All of the seasoning was on point. I got fried trout as my entree and it came with a side of potato salad. The trout was butterflied and perfectly fried. The potato salad wasn't the traditional salad that you're used to. It didn't seem to have any mayonnaise and it was almost refreshing in a way. It had a tiny hint of citrus with some minced cilantro, green onion, and dill. All in all, the food was great and the prices were reasonable. I can't wait to go back to try a different dish. I just wish they had more chicken dishes since I can't eat pork.

This place is amazing! The service was nice, fast, and very friendly. I felt right at home -- as if I was back in Bulgaria! The menu was very extensive and the food delicious. The prices were very reasonable and all the dishes were very very fresh. When we were leaving, the waitress even came out to say goodbye to us. Too bad that this isn't in LA -- oh well that means that we'll be coming to Vegas more often ;) 

Highly recommended for everyone! In our weekend trip to Vegas we stopped here THREE times. This place is why we decided to come to Vegas in the first place.
Exceptional food. Great service! Every time I go to Las Vegas, visit this restaurant multiple times and I really enjoy the food. The environment is very pleasant.

I came here cuz I wanted something different in the area.  Found them on Yelp...I go to the plaza often to go to Smiths and to buy gas but never got food anywhere here and I never knew this existed.
I drove up the clientele seems all of Eastern decent...
Also, what is an Asian guy doing coming here alone is the look I got when I walked in...
I got my food to go...they have a restaurant on one side and a bar on the other side...separated...
The waitress didn't speak English fluently but I was able to order with no problems...paid for the food waited about 15 minutes and when it was ready she brought it to me...I gave her a tip and she tried to refuse it...not sure why...maybe cuz I ordered to go...but she was nice and helpful and deserved a tip...so I told her she could keep it...
Man when I drove back the food smelled so good I really had to eat it..all I got were the chicken skewers with veggies and a bean salad...it came with bread as well...
Overall, I would recommend this food to anybody who wants to try some Bulgarian (European) food...

Amazing cusine
Very authentic Bulgarian Dishes
If you would like to explore Bulgarian traditional dishes in Vegas rhis is your place.
And for All Bulgarians visiting Vegas its a must as much as it is the Belagio Fountains
All dishes are amazing
My favorite is the Chicken Soupe and all salads
You have to try the 
 
        
The staff is super friendly, polite and very fast
Most of the food is cook to order
Great Place

Came here on a Friday night (April 14, 2017) with a group of seven.  We were seated inside and two of us happen to be able to speak Bulgarian, so it was really great that the waiters were also Bulgarian and were able to converse with them.  The food here is extremely authentic to food back from Bulgaria.  For a few hours, we were transported to the other side of the world.  Not only is the food good, but the staff is also very friendly. Our waiter was Ivaylo and he was nothing but smiles. We felt very much at home.  

As far as must eat foods here - have the Shopska Salad, French Fries with Bulgarian cheese and the Kebabche...the list goes on.  All the food is really really really good. We even had a sampler platter.  

Many thanks to the owner and the staff for opening up this restaurant in Vegas. I'm from LA and there are no such places here, so it was great to find a place like this in Vegas.

Will be bringing my mom back here in the future. If you're in Vegas, you HAVE to go eat here.

Wow I am surprised. I didn't know that Bulgarians can cook meat this well. This is a perfect family restaurant with very appropriate pricing. Grab the family come out here on a Friday night they have a very lovely band playing 60s 70s favorites, non intrusive music, be sure to order lamb and in-house sausages you will not be disappointed.

We happened upon this restaurant today at lunchtime.  Inside, the small dining area was comfortable, with music playing in the adjoining bar.  The waitperson was friendly and helpful.  We tried an appetizer that was reminiscent of a potato pancake.  It was savory and delicious.  I don't recall the name.  I had the spinach soup, which tasted like it was homemade from scratch.  My husband tried the vegetable gyuvech, which tasted similar to ratatouille, in a way.  It was served in a charming clay pot which it is apparently cooked in, which is also called a gyuvech.  Best of all:  The bread!  It was fresh, hot, and delicious, and they brought extra!  I dipped it in the soup and the flavors complimented one another.  When the check came out, we were pleased at how affordable our lunch was.  The only thing I don't understand is: Why wasn't this place packed?  With the delicious food, friendly service and good prices, there should be a line out the door!

We had an amazing time, celebrated St George at BG Bistro. The Lamb was delicious, the snow white is the best thing I have in a long time. After the wonderful music, vodka, and lamb we left and after sleeping in, went back for lunch. The Owner is a very sweet man and all the servers are happy and so nice. The stuffed red peppers are perfect, light batter, delicious filling, and not oily. We had the mixed grill and the sausage was very good, juicy and not over cooked, but not greasy either. This is one of my new favorite places. the relaxed feel and joy, it is like chilling at home but with better food. If you smoke, the entire bar is smoking area, there is a patio and another side that is non smoking. The seating is very lounge like and comfortable. I could stay here there and graze all day.

Having lived in Bulgaria for a couple years I was so excited when I saw this restaurant pop up as I was visiting Vegas.  It is 100% legit from the Shopska Salata with Sirene cheese, Tarator soup, and various dishes all spot on to the traditional Bulgarian cuisine.  The decor is also awesome with various photos of famous Bulgarians.  If you haven't tried this place or want to experience some amazing Eastern European cuisine check it out.  Stefani also provided us with some amazing service!

We love BG Bistro! I so wish we had Bulgarian food in LA! We eat here every time we come to Vegas! This weekend,  we ate here three days in a row and it was great every time! To bad they don't deliver to LA! Also, while what I can eat is more limited because I can't eat *gluten* or *dairy*, there's still plenty I can eat, like salads, meatballs, eggplant, stuffed peppers, etc. If you've never tried Bulgarian food, come here! You won't regret it!

I want to give this place a 5. But it's not quite there for me. Let me just say right up front, that it is the BEST Bulgarian restaurant I have eaten in on the west coast. Period. If you're west of the Mississippi and would like Bulgarian food - this has to be it in my experience.

Located at a strip mall, it's not really screaming "come and try me", but it is very, very nicely done on the inside. Since it's Vegas and seems like half the people in this town smoke - they've done a very good job at splitting the restaurant in two - smoking and non smoking section. I utilized the non-smoking section and I am sensitive to this stuff, and I couldn't really smell it at all. So great job on that. Decor is nice with lots of Bulgarian themed pictures on the wall. 

We shared and sampled a bunch of things on the menu and I can definitely say it felt quite authentic. I wish they actually used Bulgarian cheese for their Paniran Kashkaval, but the substitue was quite good. The kebapcheta were fantastic and the Shopska Salad was well done. The Lukanka is overpriced for what it is but it was quite good. The rest of the menu items were reasonably priced. 

Like it is typical in Bulgaria - they don't really have fountain drinks - you do get your soda in a bottle, which is both cool, and annoying. Cool because it brings a feel of Bulgaria, but annoying because as a red blooded American I want my soda to be unlimited ;). 

Great experience overall and if you are seeking, or are curious about Bulgarian food - definitely check this place out!

The vibe here is amazing and the food selection was wide in range. The only issue I had was the multiple servers and the long wait for the check. It took about 30 mins for us to get everything settled and get out!
Great food, and a huge plate for your money. Very traditional, and always full of the local Europeans. Have a cold Grappa at the bar and step out of Vegas for a minute!

Just found this gem of a restaurant in Feb. 2018. Heard some good rumors about it so I thought me and my wife should explore it.
We've been on the lounge side of it.
The atmosphere is somehow matching the lounges from Eastern Europe. I like that. Nice lighting, nice vibes, nice music.
Really nice waitresses, especially the petite lady ( I forgot her name, sorry!).
We ordered the tripe soup, the beef soup, the mititei, the kashcaval pane and their sausages. Amazingly tasting food.
Me and my wife just couldn't stop.
I was still remembering my mom's tripe soup from half a year ago. This one was no different! Highly recommended for the people understanding this is not your regular chicken soup and some might not enjoy it.
One of the owners, a really nice lady, came twice by our table to make sure everything's alright.
I saw the yelp reviews and I understand no businesses can have a 100% 5 star reviews and not everyone can be 100% satisfied but you have to give it a try!
This is one of those businesses that's bringing joy to so many people missing the hearty, soul food back home.
Wish I would find in here some Turkish chebureki, but hey, you can't have it all.

Those being said, I highly recommend you to try it. And by the way, I'm from Romania. Greetings to Bulgaria and thank you for your business guys!

So my cousin keeps raving about this spot since I took him to another spot very similar concept Forte. It just happened that the other night stars align got together for dinner. Forte for me best of the best comes to Bulgarian or Eastern European food. I came in with open mind not compare both places but obviously similarity in the food and other things very different. Overall say both solid choice if need for legit Bulgarian food.

The first impression with the ambience and decor interesting. They have the restaurant broken down in two sections on one side there the bar and another side just straight restaurant dining. The whole point of that is restaurant part is non smoking so guess wanted keep it true. You can see the other side since part of it glass walls. I never walked around the bar area but modern, like the way look from the outside, and bar tables area that can order food. In the bar area lots of wide screens usually have games on. They definitely stick with european theme has english premier soccer league games on. Also on the restaurant side they have wide screens. The artwork feels Bulgarian all along the walls. 

It was my first time but like mention earlier cousin is HUGE HUGE fan. So for the most part just followed his lead came to ordering. He recommended trying the stuffed peppers, mixed grill, and the biscuit cake. I started with the chicken soup just cause Forte has the best chicken soup and as much as keep open mind. I saw chicken soup just had to get it. It was good. Talk about huge bowl. It was definitely hearty soup with lots of chicken, potato, and couple more ingredients. Flavor wise good but lacked deep and no WOW like Forte. Forte just fyi half the size bowl. But call it a cliche sometimes bigger not always better. The stuffed peppers was tasty nice feta cheese filling and solid. It deep fried with batter. Again similar but different stuffed peppers at Forte same concept just not batter and deep fried. The mixed grill that was the big comparison. The meats were really good. Three different ones plus pork chop. The names not remember but totally traditional style one sausage link style, another more hand form patty style, lamb skewer, and the pork chop. It was served with massive amount of yogurt /cucumber sauce. The link and patty were both really good. Either spot could just be carnivore all night long. The subtle differences keep going back to between the two spots. The mixed grill at Forte get three different meats only but like the fact the sides get three different awesome sides. Again you get more food for your mixed grill but is bigger always better?? The biscuit cake was interesting. Nothing think traditional biscuit about the dish. Truth it was delicious. It heavy dessert so make sure leave room cause its one of the popular dishes on the menu. One that if going for dessert end night at BG Bistro would highly recommend. The 3 egg omelette exactly that basic but added ham. It was loaded with feta cheese mix. It was actually filling but overall probably not the best item show Bulgarian cuisine. My bet. 

The service was fabulous! One thing interesting they have button that can call the server (they have watches that buzz them). Friendly, attentive, and awesome.

All the prices are very reasonable most items under ten dollars. The grill items or little more. You get lot of food for your money.

I love this place!! I am Bulgarian but my husband is American and we have 3 kids and we all love the food and the service!  Every time we come to Las Vegas from LA we stop here. The food is fresh and delicious, no matter what you order.  The prices are very very reasonable.  The service is amazing, we love everyone especially Ani! The deserts are also amazing!  Come and enjoy!

I ordered food last night and it was amazing 
Will keep continue forever
The food is so fresh and tasty 
My husband loves his lamp chops and I loved the chicken soup and the bread 
Everything is great
For find Bulgarian Cuisine, this place is awesome! The atmosphere is very modern and the bathrooms are very clean. The owner is very friendly. This is a great place to eat all kinds of European food

What a pleasant surprise! Food was great, server was pleasant and on spot and the ambiance was comfy bistro.
For the reviews that say things about the smoking-the rooms are totally separated into a smoking w/lounge and a non smoking dining room and actually, it offers choice.
No smell of smoke at all.
We will be back to this neighborhood gem.

Went last night to see the Chris Koman band (which sounded fantastic).  We ordered a chicken caesar salad, sausage kabob plate and french fries, one beer, sparkling water, iced tea, and bottled water.  The meal came with fresh hot bread and butter to start.  The bill came to $26.  I couldn't believe how inexpensive everything was and really good food.  Great atmosphere and the waitress was very sweet.  We will be going back quite often.

The food and service was awesome! Flavorful and fresh. I had the kebaptcha and shopka salad (probably spelled that really wrong haha). I would definitely come back again! No rice though (I'm so Asian lol)

Yummmmy Eastern European food!!! I love their Mititei, (grilled skinless sausage) so delicious. Chicken soup is heavenly and so comforting, like my Romanian grandma's... Staff is nice and polite, waitresses are sweet and friendly. So happy this place exists.

Found this gem from the newspaper review section.
   Strip mall so easy parking.
    The yogurt with feta cheese and orange zest was just right on toasted bread hot from the oven.   
    The lamb chops were perfect. 
    Baklava was the best we have ever tasted and we like desserts.
     The red Bulgarian wine was good and also very inexpensive for Vegas. 
     Plus the total price was way inexpensive for a great value. We have been there 2 times and will go back for sure.

Had lunch here today
I enjoyed my meal,The Jazz music And the Decor of the Restaurant. 
Veronica my waitress made me feel very welcome and the service along with my meal was Great 
Thank you
Mark

Food and atmosphere are truly amazing.  Very authentic Bulgarian. A family atmosphere, with  great portion sizes. I also really liked that there were lots of pictures of the food to help you if it's your first time.
The very first day was today and they did a great  job. The food was delicious and authentic. We (the bulgarians) need it back from a long time... Friendly stuff. Thank you!

right on Jones and Tropicana next to the Smith's
Staff is great! Angie took care of our table. She was so so sweet and took time to go over the whole menu!
I LOVE Bulgarian gastronomy and this bistro is a Jewel in town Beside Forte!
Smoker??? lucky you BG has actually 2 restaurants 1 for smoker and 1 for non smoker!
Both restaurant are well decorated and very cozy.
the atmosphere of the. on smoking restaurant was very elegant with beautiful paint from Bulgarian high profiles I believe. Tonight live music by 3 gentlemen who were asking us what music we like them to play! Really enjoyed it!
We ordered the Shepard salad the Shopska salad (cucumber, tomato, bulgarian feta cheese), 1 kashkaval pane (white cheese breaded and toasted) YUMMY YUMMY!
then Mixed grill and Karnache sausage with sautéed potato sprinkled with garlic
Not sure were they grow their tomato but the taste of it, the color are amazing!
We finished our diner sharing a Rustic French cake made of yogurt layers of strawberry jam and an expresso!
Service was great, Live Music excellent, Gastronomy fairly priced and very fresh and tasty!
Place is great for groups and events
Bon appetit

Ok...I am basing this review purely on taste and value. I like to usually enjoy good food in the comfort of my own home and though I love to cook, there are times when I just want to eat something that I do not have to prepare. Such was a time when I came across this little gem...I have been to Bulgaria once, and found that their food, much like the rest of Eastern Europe style cuisine, is very hearty and rich, but nonetheless very tasty!  I had ordered a take out of feta cheese style fries (based on other reviewers raving about it!), and the Gyuveche with chicken (as it seemed similar to Hungarian Lecso). The girl who took my order said it would be about 25 minutes since the Gyuveche took some time to cook.  Love the fact that most Eastern Europeans take pride in their cooking and take the time to believe in quality!!!  When I picked up my order, I was surprised to see so much in the bag...I had my two entrees I ordered...enough for 2-3...PLUS they included a bag of their house bread....and these were a couple of large rolls!!!! The taste? Wonderful and flavorful....!!!!!!! To top it off, I have leftovers for days and did not have to break the bank!!!!!!!

I tried this with my husband the other day, we wanted to try something different, never had bulgarian food before. The waitresses were super nice and attentive, the ambiance was nice, we sat in the non smoking spot, and the food was AWESOME and decently priced.
The cheese is imported from Bulgaria, so tasty.
A great surprise, will definitely go back.
Food is way better than expected.  Nice authentic staff.  Delicious food.  Full bar.  What more could you want.
Delicious, friendly and affordable. Updated decor and family friendly. The items are al le carte. Warm bread served with the meal but no butter. The olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Music is mixed.

Faster delivery than I thought and great lamb chops and so affordable.. I can't believe 4 big O Lamb chop comes with bread and potatoes gravy for only $12.99 and chicken kabobs are delicious and so juicy and tender for only $7.99 . Most affordable and so much food than I thought I highly recommend this great restaurant to all local and tourist.

It was like to open Time Capsule from mid seventies 
( time of communist dictator Todor Zivkov). 
Nothing changed since, food was .... just just mediocre and the service was terrible like in seventies. Because  I did not speak Bulgarian ( front of staff) we were practically ignored by young waitress.
I was checking out this restaurant because wanted to introduce Bulgarian Food to my son in law, daughter and our 7 years old granddaughter as part of my Bulgarian experience in seventies. Never again.... even that I am speak the language and maybe more familiar with Bulgarian cuisine then most of waitresses there.

i think i'm adventurous with foods, compared to the average person, but i haven't had much of this type of cuisine.

i enjoyed it very much! everything i had was yummy. I'd definitely come back.

I love the ambiance here. You can choose a smoking area with a lounge experience or fine dining with soft music and great energy. I'm an exotic eater. I really love the buttered tripe here. Covered in cheese and cooked to perfection.

Yesterday we had a dinner with dear friends at BG Bistro. Our friend's father, whose family was from Bulgaria, wanted Bulgarian food. Since we have eaten here on several occasions (my husband also is of Bulgarian descent) and been thrilled with the authenticity of the meals, and the very helpful staff, we brought him here and to say it was enjoyable falls short of the truth.
First of all, I really am impressed with the redecoration/renovation efforts. The dining room is non-smoking and no longer exposed to the bar as much as it was in 2015. The look is clean and spacious, and we don't have to sit within arms' reach of the next table. This to me is very special.
Two of us had kebabcha, one had mixed grill, and there were sauteed mushrooms (my favorite) and "mish mash"- Bulgarian cheese and eggs. You know I sampled everything- who wouldn't?
The meats were tender and well seasoned, and service by Anna was very attentive.
My stepmother in law, who is from Bulgaria, really prefers to eat here too, as the food is reminiscent of home, so my husband gets out here more often, for lunches with her when I am working.
We appreciate the warm welcomes, the staff expertise, and of course, great food! My friend's father extended a huge congratulatory message to the manager via the server as he was thrilled with the experience.

Very nice small restaurant in Spring Valley. We had never tried Bulgarian food, but if it's this good, we were totally missing out. Everything is so tasty, the staff is helpful and friendly and educated us on food we were not otherwise familiar with. I like the wall dividing the different rooms, and really liked the decor and intimate feeling of the quiet side. Only downside was the way the food was brought to the table. Instead of bringing appetizers, entrees etc out together, all of my husbands food was brought out first while I sat for another 10 minutes without anything.
Amazing little bistro. The food is great and service is exceptional. Need to try the lamb chops!

I'm absolutely in love with the jazz music they play here while you're chowing down. I also love how there is a completely separate 1,000 sq. ft. of retail restaurant space for the non-smokers to eat! I wish every restaurant would adopt this idea so that we may breathe a little easier. 

Okay, food; focus ...

We started our evening with a couple of different appetizers. The stuffed peppers, and the caprese. Both wonderful! Although I will mention that the stuffed peppers were absolutely fantastic. Being the carnivore that I am, I proceeded to order the mixed grill with a shopska salad on the side topped with Bulgarian feta cheese which was really great! This is a platter that consists of kebabche, kufte, porkchop, and pork shish kabob. The porkchop was super dry, and I wasn't able to finish it. Everything else on this platter is absolutely phenomenal! Next, I decided to finish the meal with the biscuit cake, absolutely amazing! It's like a tiramisu.

I quickly scanned the wine menu to see if there were any wines that may pair well with the biscuit cake, I noticed the very last wine item by the glass on the menu--"Sweet Red Wine" I definitely should've asked the waiter about it first because it definitely was not a sweet wine. Most likely one of the driest wines I've ever had. I didn't drink it, and they wouldn't take it off the bill. I'll live but you'd think someone who is ordering a wine called "Sweet Red Wine" while ordering a dessert item is probably looking for a dessert wine; wish the waiter would've said something.

Perhaps the wait staff works on commission? That jazz music though ...

Yelp says this is a Mediterranean place, but it's actually Bulgarian cuisine.

 I had the mixed grill plate, which was alright. Service seemed like it would of been good if you are Bulgarian. I felt like an outsider invading their restaurant lol.


My friend that I ate with got food poisoning! Be careful!

Met a friend here for lunch today.  What a great find!  Our waitress was helpful and told us about the dishes - she was very knowledgeable.  We ordered the Vitamin Salad, Shopski Style Cheese appetizer and Pileshko Vreteno (I think that was what it was called) main course.  First out was a homemade white bread that melted in our mouths.  Then the Vitamin Salad was served - it is made from shredded beets, shredded apple, walnuts and dressed with a light, honey-based dressing.  Delicious and it tastes like the best smoothie ever.  The Shopski Style Cheese, our waitress explained, is made from Bulgarian feta which is baked with tomato sauce and topped with an egg.  We both thought that herbs used in this dish made it stand out and the cheese took on a nice consistency.  The main course was a pounded piece of pork stuffed with a slice of ham, herbed cream cheese and pickles.  This meaty dish was nicely browned/seared on the outside and when we cut into it, the lovely cheesy middle seeped into the accompanying french fries.  The meal was rich so I brought back plenty of leftovers for my co-workers.  I hope they enjoy the food as much as I did.  We both decided to come back with the hubbies for a fun couples dinner and to try some of the wonderful sounding drinks and desserts.  There is 1 side that is all restaurant and no smoking and a completely separate side that includes a bar that allows smoking and serves food.  I am now a fan of Bulgarian food!

Good food, but uhhh shady-looking restaurant, lol. 

I found this place on a search for soup in the area since my mother-in-law had dental surgery and needs something that doesn't require chewing. 

Recommendations: 
Chicken soup -- We got this for my MIL. Sounds lame but this was very good, thicker than your typical chicken broth and full of vegetables and chunks of chicken breast. 
Kotlety -- 3 ground meat patties, seasoned well and very juicy
Vitamin Salad -- sounds like bullshit but very good combination of shredded beets, carrots, apples and ground walnuts. This place has a large salad section on the menu that all sort of resemble Greek salads with the use of feta but have a Eastern European influence. 
Mish Mash -- this one was a bit salty but a good scramble of eggs, feta, tomatoes and peppers. 

Pros: 
Price!  This place is surprisingly reasonable -- it looked like a more pricey sit-down place but the price is decent for the serving sizes (except for the kotlety which was a bit pricey). 
Food was really good. 
Pretty diverse menu so there was something for everyone in our group. 

Cons: 
Holy moly, opening the door, the place reeked of smoke. I was told by the hostess that there's a non-smoking section but I'm not sure if they meant it was the outdoor seating (there's a bunch of tables and seats in front of the restaurant). 
Dark inside. It reminded me of a saloon with playboy bunny-esque waitresses. 
Food took a while to come out

Delightful serendipity- we were meeting friends at another restaurant which turned out to be closed, ended up here based on Yelp reviews. Everything was delicious and very filling and excellent service. The bean soup was one of the specials and was absolutely yummy. We also had the stuffed peppers, meatballs, and chicken kv and some salads and biscuit cake for dessert. Definitely will be back!

I chose the place because of the idea of trying different exotic cuisine and this is the first time I had Bulgarian food. I came here last night with a couple of friends. 

The restaurant was opened around 2013 and I am surprised I haven't found it sooner. Upon research, this is the only Bulgarian restaurant in Las Vegas and I haven't found one elsewhere either so this makes the experience more special.

The restaurant had a nice vibe and we sat outside.

The waitress told us everything was homemade and I picked all her suggestions. She later came with fresh warm bread and olive oil dip. 

The food we ordered were

Stuffed Red Peppers
Zuchini with Yogurt
Chicken Soup
Kebapche
Lamb Chops
Pork Chops
Pork Kavarma
Crepe

All the dishes were flavorful and I could taste the different herbs and spices that were new to me, coupled with well seasoned filings and meat.

They also have a button on the table that can call the server.

I felt the prices are inexpensive and the portions are not small.
 
My friends and I loved the food. I definitely want to try more items on their menu next time.

The food in that restaurant is just simply amazing.Every single meal is made with love and perfection.
That place is bringing me so much happiness and it's is my main reason to visit Vegas over and over again 
Thank you!!!

I love love love this place! I will be dreaming about this food for a month until I can get back into town and come back to this restaurant!

I went here with some Bulgarian friends of mine. They knew I always wanted to try Bulgarian food and they recommended we go here.You can tell when a place is going to be really epic, when you have all the locals eating there!

I had my friends order since they knew what we should be getting. Everything we ordered it was absolutely perfect. Apparently the shaft gets all of his food is fresh every single day nothing is ever frozen ever! I cannot tell you how important that is to me. And you can definitely tell in the flavors that are presented to you here.

The prices are ridiculously inexpensive for the quality and amount of food given! They have an average wine list that I was able to order from.  - loved that! 

I gave this four stars because I can see how someone that doesn't speak the language might have a problem ordering or communicating  with the waitress.

This place is a bit dark, but I understand they will be expanding a new wing to it so it's possible that might change very quickly.

I love this place! And will go back again and again and again it is worth every single penny!

It was my first time eating Bulgarian food. I was excited, my BF took me here while we were on a Vegas trip. We ordered the tarator soup, grilled Bulgarian spiced sausages, and the cabbage dish with pork (forgot the name of this). All dishes were good, especially the sausages. They were tasty and very flavorful. The tarator soup, which was made of yogurt, cucumber, and dill;  was served cold, it's like eating a salad but in a liquid soup version, very healthy. The cabbages with pork was also delicious!

Overall delicious food, very flavorful and big portions. We were a group from SF, LA and LV and everyone loved the food. Our server was very polite and helpful and one of the managers kept checking on us and helping with questions.
The food- European with a touch of Mediterranean = Bulgarian.  The Tarator is a cold yogurt, cucumber and dill soup which was extremely refreshing.  Another ordered the chicken soup which comes in a large bowl and tastes home made.  For an appetizer the cheese Shopksy style was amazing.  It comes in a small clay pot and is filled with melted feta, tomatoes and egg and spices.  Everyone loved it.  The assorted salad with amazing potato salad, cucumbers and bean salad.  The bean salad alone is a large and flavorful plate. 
The salmon was grilled perfectly and was a very large cut especially for the price.  The chicken and pork shish were slightly blackened, and good cuts of meat.  The Melba is a good finish of ice cream and fruit.  
Our server pointed out the Bulgarian mixed spice (paprika, salt, etc.) was great on the bread with butter or on meat.  It was.
The dining room is separated from the bar and dance floor, the decor is fairly modern but has Bulgarian pictures on the walls.  The facility seems very clean.  Service is very good.  If you are a foodie or want something different and tasty, don't miss this.
Food is amazing and the service is excellent.Cost is very affordable. Relaxing.Good for family and kids .

Firstable,  This place is Bulgarian NOT  Mediterranean.  Place looks clean at first but upon closer examination I found chair covers are so dirty I felt
 uncomfortable sitting in chair. THE MUSIC IN RESTAURANT IS SO LOUD I FEEL LIKE I'M AT A BAR. It's a rap concert inside of a tiny restaurant.  I asked waitress to turn it down. maybe all the employees are hard of hearing. lolll
food is good compare to price. very inexpensive. 
as far as coming back?  nahhhhh
Yoana and Zorintsa were so attentive and very friendly! Great food, great drinks and amazing customer service. Above and beyond! A Must Try the Bulgarian crapes and biscuit cake!

Love this restaurant! My Bulgarian friend introduced me to it and we have tried a lot of things on the menu and they are all awesome. Highly recommend the shopska salad, chicken kavarma, kefteta, or any of the Bulgarian meat dishes! My vegeterian friends loved the salads and the potatoes. Celebrated my birthday here and the staff were wonderful. You have to save room for the biscuit cake! The biscuit cake is the best! The other desserts are great too. The ice cream is huge and the baclava is great, but the biscuit cake is so soft and it melts in your mouth and you just have to try it! Can't wait to come back and keep introducing people to this awesome restaurant.

Was here in Las Vegas for a conference and stayed longer to rest and try some new places to eat. Tired of the Strip and everything being so overpriced. Jumped onto Yelp! and looked for Middle Eastern restaurants and something open late. BG Bistro came up as one of the places still open at 10pm. Well, its Bulgarian food. Never considered it to be Middle Eastern but from the amazing smells and looking at the food around us we decided "why the hell not!" 

We ordered a selection of kebabs, sausages, pork, and chicken. For sides I had the potato salad and my partner had the fries. Everything was so amazing even the bread was nice and crusty and hot and chewy. Everything was super fresh and full of flavour.  Cooked perfectly. We had a hard time picking out which was our favourite. The fries were really well prepared and had, had some kind of coating. Super crispy on the outside and hot and tender on the insides. The potato salad was different than any I have had before. Lots of sweet onion, oil, vinegar and lemon style dressing and melted in my mouth. 

The service was great and judging by the crowd it looked like it was a family friendly place with a lot of Bulgarian people enjoying the food, the bar, the soccer game on the TV's, and outside some people were drinking and playing backgammon.

Been here a couple of times food is good service is good had the risotto, shopska salad, grid cheese, fried red peppers stuffed with cheese, biscuit cake.

I ordered the chucked skewer which were burnt to a crisp but took it back with no questions other than that all was good.

Will be back:)

So I was shocked that everyone reviewed this place as being great food wise. 

What can I say, I'm a real foodie that is used to good quality in Toronto, ON & the food has to be great or even passable for me to give it even 3 stars.

While the chicken soup was okay, it lacked flavor. The pickled veggies were terrible. They must have poured a gallon of vinegar on them. Oh & they came out soooo cold, which ruins the taste as well.

The bread was so so with the butter which was good (of course they don't make their own butter LOL)

I don't remember the name of the dish I ordered, but it's on the last page & it has some veggies with chicken in a red sauce. They weren't able to take the mushrooms out for me so I ended up eating some because they dominated the dish.

The chicken was overcooked & again, the flavor wasn't anything that wowed me at all.

The waitress was fast at first, but even AFTER putting our food in take out containers, she never brought the bill. I'm not talking 5 minutes later, it must have been 15-20 minutes before I caught her to ask for it otherwise we'd still be sitting there waiting for it.

Other than that she was okay except when my date asked for more bread, she didn't bring more butter.

I would never go back. I don't care what kind of food it is, I know good food when I taste it.

To be fair, my date (wasn't a date date) liked his dish & said he'd return. Now I can't trust his palette LOL

Perhaps your experience will be better.

This is close to a four star restaurant but I'll stay with three until I get to go back and try more, especially the chicken livers.

I stopped here for a combined lunch/dinner.  With the help of my server, Anelia, I ordered a sensible amount of food--more than normal for lunch but large enough to be dinner too and not be hungry at 7 PM.

I ordered and iced tea and I was brought some house made bread.  I ordered the Bulgarian feta with lukanka, egg, and tomatoes in a super hot small black pot.  This was my appetizer and it was a great starter.  The melted feta was really good and the lukanka--Bulgarian style salami--was quite good.  The hot tomatoes mixed in also added to the good flavor.

I had a harder time language-wise while trying to pick the main course.  Anelia suggested the special of the day, which sounded to me like some kind of meat that was going to be stuffed in paper.  Sounded good so why not?  It turned out that it was stuffed peppers, you know, stuffed papers.  They have an appetizer that's red peppers stuffed with feta, but this is only done as a special.  

When I was a youngster, I didn't think of my mother's stuffed peppers as food but rather as punishment.  These were a bit different but somewhat the same.  The peppers were red peppers.  They were stuffed with a ground beef and rice combination but instead of a tomato sauce topping, they were topped with a sour cream sauce.  The filling need salt.  It really was bland.

For dessert, I had what they call French cake.  Anelia had a difficult time describing it to me but it's layers of cream cheese, very thin pastry, and raspberry sauce.  It was a very refreshing dessert for our summer heat!

I really need to come back here and try more.  I'm sure I've only scratched the surface.  

For those wondering where this place is, it's in the same plaza and only steps away from the Black Bear Diner on Trop.

Everything here is AMAZING! I'm even obsessed with the bread and season oil they give u. HEAVENLY! The service is excellent and atmosphere is lovely and welcoming. Definitely a lovely place and will be visiting again soon

I am a fan of this place because it is extremely unique and even though I've been in the F&B business for the majority of my life, I've never had Bulgarian food before. The place is quaint, a tiny little spot in a strip mall, but it has tons of culture. The staff was extremely friendly and guided us through the menu.
Very good and nice European food.amazing and Very yummy very great prices for such amazing food not

Great Bulgarian cuisine! While a few of the chicken based dishes may qualify as "lackluster", the beef and lamb are just perfect! Spiced potatoes with gravy, better than a benny! The yogurt with feta, a perfect blend of sweet and sour that it may be featured at your next Chinese dinner! Great atmosphere (has two areas: a lounge with comfortable and informal seating, and the restaurant which I find to be even more comfortable. Went on a whim, and now it's one of my spots!

First off the food was great. We had the shopska salad to start. The cheese on top of the salad just melts in your mouth. It was delicious. We also ordered the meat platter that came with a potato salad and fries. The two dishes was definitely enough for two people. To end the night, we had an espresso and baklava. The baklava is amazing!!! It was served warm with this yummy syrupy sauce!! 

The only thing that was lacking is customer service. 
I don't know if it was because we were sitting outside, but come on does it really take 35 min to give us our check even when we called for you?

the food was really good! tasted fresh and flavorful. me and my boyfriend tried some new dishes and enjoyed our meal. they had many vegetarian options for me and a lot of meat choices for my boyfriend. we only paid $26 for 1 appetizer, 2 entrees, and a dessert!! really good prices and big menu. server was very nice and helpful. she asked a few times if we had any questions about the food (as some of the words were Bulgarian) and she explained the dishes well. definitely will be back and will be bringing friends.

i love the food and the service at this place , i go there about 3-5 times a week ,lol .i should probably buy stocks there too 
food is amazing -bulgarian  and the owner is the friendliest person ever 
would recommend this place to everyone
I love this place, always a regular here. Food is delish and staff friendly!!!!
Great food, very comfortable place! The stuff is very friendly! 5 stars from me! :)

Muy buen servicio amables y atentos. Pase por primera vez a comer y el servicio me gusto y fueron muy amables con migo y mi familia definitivamente lo recomiendo a pesar de no hablar bien inglés me atendieron excelentemente gracias

What an awesome place. Their menu is filled with a rather large variety of eastern european deliciousness. I have been here for lunch and dinner and the key is always to be seated at the non-smoking section. I think they should also not allow smoking on the outside tables as it is very displeasing to have a meal and inhale unintentionally cigarette smoke. If you are new to Bulgarian cuisine, I recommend trying the feta stuffed peppers, the Shepard salad and the mixed grill. Always ask for the special since they change daily. BG Bistro is also a master in the soups. They are all made from scratch and are a true rarity to find elsewhere.

Well the place looks nice, but of course if you do not look eastern european, forget getting serviced, we waited for 15 mintues to get anyone to service, but they were too busy serving their fellow countrymen while others wait, the funny thing is no one was busy, 2 servers one bartender and all they do is just socialize and shoot the sh*t and not do their job, never again! And i am only giving one star cause i liked how the place looked, it has a lot of potential but with that kind of service they are only targeting one crowed and thats it.
BG Bistro you are the Bomb!! I've never been disappointed everything fresh and delicious. I love the atmosphere as well... a real bistro. Love you guys!!

We had a beautiful lunch here yesterday for my friends late birthday celebration. We started off with one of each of the salads...they were amazing so light and delicious with just the right amount of dressing we all loved them. We had some roasted potatoes with cheese that were to die for. Then we had a meat plate with beef kabobs, lamb chops, and sausage.All executed great and very delicious. And just for fun we ordered a pizza which was also excellent!! Our server Veronica was fantastic and my girlfriend Jacky would have no one else serve us, Veronica did an amazing job and made us feel welcome. We finished off with biscuit cake and cappuccino and expresso.I would highly recommend this place. We will be back.

I stopped in for lunch. It is Bulgarian food. I had some kind of bean salad. It was pretty good. I also ordered the Bulgarian feta. The Bulgarians make the best feta cheese. You have to try it. It has much more flavor than other feta and has a stronger smell to it.

There are no enough words to describe how this place is awesome!
Food is superb delicious - completely unique place and food in LV!

Our waiter was Veronika, and she was so helpful describing their special dishes. I took the best grilled fish I ever tried i Vegas. 
In the end we took crepes and biscuit cake... I am truly looking forward to come back for next round! :)

The chicken kebob and the pork chop were really good. The meatball and pork kebob were so-so. 

The feta is not the same as Greek feta, it lacks a little in the taste department. 

As one other user put it, bring your own butter. The bread was pretty good even without it. 

Here is something to note. The restaurant is on the right and the bar/lounge is on the left.   The problem is that people smoke in the bar and there is no actual air separation between the two. There is a pony wall with window blinds, but prepare to reek of cigarette smoke when you are done here. Not sure how this has been overlooked by the Health Department, but it has. For this reason alone, I am unlikely to return. If this is something that does not bother you, then you may very well enjoy this place.

Negative stars if I could!!! The waitress tonight screwed up our whole order!!! We talked about walking out for ever...she's lucky I am a waitress myself..the absolute worst service I have ever had in my life..everyone at the table was pissed..

I brought my lunch group here for lunch at 1pm today. We sat in the non-smoking dining room which was crowded with large groups. Between all at our table we ordered many different salads, appetizers, entrees and desserts to really get a taste of what the restaurant had to offer. Over all, everything was excellent. Very tasty and very fresh. I understand they do not freeze anything but cook it fresh daily. They make their own sausage and cut up their own chickens daily. You could tell. The sausage, pork kebobs, chicken and meatballs were all delicious. Home made bread was to die for. Loved the large offering of salads. I was too full for dessert but others tried some. They looked wonderful. 
Service was good. The kitchen was slow but we survived.  We will come again to try other items on the menu. The only complaint I had was we had to keep asking for ice. And to have our drinks refilled. Apparently, they do not do refills on drinks. But they were gracious enough to give us separate checks (which is one of our groups requirements-we will not go to any restaurant that does not accommodate us with that. Room was big but a little dark. So happy not to be in the smoking room. They even have an outdoor patio if the weather is nice. Great place.

I love BG Bistro. I go there with friends and family every time we visit Las Vegas. It is a MUST stop for everybody who likes good cuisine, nice drinks, good service and good decoration. Their service is nice and always strives to give their best. We have tried almost every dish and we have liked them all. In addition to the regular menu they keep a daily menu with additional 15-20 dishes, which gives you the opportunity to try something new every time. I have a sweet tooth, and let me tell you their desserts are also amazing. If I could give them more than 5 stars I would. We have tried many restaurants on and off the strip and this one is by far one of the best!!!
This was the best meal we have had since getting to Vegas! Alexandra was our amazing server, extremely accommodating and nice! Huge portions at a great price all cooked to perfection! EAT HERE!

This was my first time here. There are two separate parts to this location. There is a smoking bar side and a casual dining side (smoke free). I took a look at both sides and both are very nice. I ended up in the smoke free dining area. The waiters/waitresses are great. They help each other out so you will never be waiting long for anything. The waitress we had helped me out with explaining what some food on the menu was. I ordered the cheese,potato and ham meal. It wasn't bad. Liked the kind of cheese they used. I also ordered a Bulgarian beer. Wasn't too bad. Reminder we me of a glorified miller lite. For dessert I had the biscuit cake. I devoured it. This cake is a coffee lovers dream!  All in all it was a fun experience and when my adventurous side is looking for a good meal I may swing by here

Friend of mine brought me to this restaurant and had a great meal so I came back with my girlfriend we had a great meal. I forgot the waiter's name is I think Melan Tall bald guy he made a meal so enjoyable the girlfriend had a problem with one dish and he worked it out and made us feel good about it.
Replaced the meal with something better and made special for her.

BG Bistro is a great relaxing environment. Authentic food and a nice place to hang outside if  the temperature outside is nice. Any European food you may be looking for you can find it here! I enjoy good food and good environments so BG Bistro is a must when you are in the area.

Went to my first Bulgarian restaurant ever and here in Las Vegas.  Its quaintly located in a shopping center off of Tropicana and by first glance you can't tell much but once inside it reminds me of a N.Y restaurant where only locals know bout it.  Very nice staff and they were extremely helpful in guiding my wife and I through the menu. Bulgarian food is great try the Sausage.

Since we don't have a single Bulgarian restaurant in Los Angeles, that would be the closest place to get some good Bulgarian food. A friend of ours took us to this newly open restaurant and to our surprise it was the same owner and even the exact same menu as the old Magura Bulgarian restaurant. Food was as remembered from 5 years ago and did not disappoint. Portions were huge for the low prices and I had to take an hour recess after lunch there. I had the beef tripe soup, chicken skewers and stuffed fried red bell peppers. My wife had the chicken soup and as usually she loved it and only mentioned it wss a tad saltier that she would have ideally have it. The free bred was delicious with some butter and home made spiced salt. The bread could be warm when served but nevertheless it was soft and delicious. My friend had the pork chop and they serve you two chops in a single serving and they were huge. I got a bite from it and it was very well marinated and grilled to perfection. The chicken skewers I had were a bit overcooked but well spiced and meat was flavorful. The portion of french fries I got with the skewers was a huge 3 people serving :) but I got it all by myself. ..specially with the grated feta cheese on top that melted....yumm.
All in all I would suggest this restaurant as a good way to introduce Bulgarian cousine to anyone open to new things.

Great atmosphere! A nice simple area to sit out, and enjoy the night. The stuffed peppers, and chicken were delicious but nothing can compare to the amazing ice cream treat we had. Fantastic place to eat European food.
I thoroughly enjoyed dining at BG Bistro, the food was delicious and the service was friendly. A must visit place in Vegas... :)

Delicious food, loved the salads and the mixed grill plate. If you love meat and home cooked meals this is the right place for you. The biscuit cake and chocolate crepes are absolutely amazing!!! The restaurant has two sections separated by a glass wall, one side for smokers, one side for non smokers. Prices are very reasonable and service is pretty good too.

Excellent food. Best salad I've had in a long time. Lovely charcuterie. Only let down is they charge for drink refills and I do not think anyone did that anymore. The bread basket was so good and yeasty. Highly recommended

Hella good food! My mom and I were late to The Palms hotel to see a movie so we drove around and decided to have a late lunch instead so I did the yelp search 'around me' and I chose this place! We are so glad we did! Nona was outside fixing up the patio and took us inside, and handed us menus and we learned it was a Bulgarian restaurant! YES! So excited because we have never had Bulgarian cuisine but my mom and I love an adventure! We put the adorable, friendly, and sweet Nona in charge of our food! We are so glad we did! Every single item Nona brought us we loved! She explained everything, made suggestions, and I will say we will definitely be back to see Nona and this gem of a restaurant in the desert! All the food tasted fresh, yummy, and so good! I'm a Bulgarian food lover now because of Nona and BG Bistro! Must go!!!!

During my first dining experience I would have given 4 Stars.  Based on that experience we made a reservation for 12 to celebrate my mother-in-law birthday.  Food was all wrong seems like the chef was confused as the orders where messed up.  Wait service was overwhelmed with the crowd.  1 senior server (outstanding) 1 trainee on a holiday weekend they should of had.a third.  We were disappointed in the orders being wrong and the slow service on a Sunday.

The food is good, however there is too much open space between the bar and the restaurant,  and the cigarette smoke gets in the eating area. Not too mention that they allowed a guy next to me to smoke at his table. Not cool!

Forte was mysteriously closed on a recent Saturday night, yet my wife was unable to shake her hunger for Eastern European cuisine.  Nothing else would do.  You know those Snickers commercials "you're not you when you're hungry"?  My wife turned into Dolph Lundgren aka Ivan Drago from Rocky 4.  For a brief moment, I feared for my life ;)  A Bulgarian friend recommended BG Bistro a while ago and it was the perfect time to give it a shot. 

I found it curious that outdoor seating was offered when all to see was a Smith's supermarket parking lot.  The cigarette smoke hit me as soon as I entered.  Was this their way of staying authentically Eastern Europe?  I kinda felt like a tourist.  With all the college football games going on that moment, they opted to show golf and soccer on their TV's to enhance the Europeanness.  I could see the smoke being a huge turnoff to prospective patrons, definitely wore it upon exit.   But on this evening, we would NOT be deterred.   DRAGO!!!

Our friendly waitress walked us through the menu and specials.  The priciest entrées were the daily specials of lamb chops or grilled trout for only $13.  I was so close to getting one of them, but the kufteta was calling my name.  Grilled Bulgarian meatballish burger patties made with pork were juicy and accompanied by 3 small salads: potato, bean (blaaand), and cabbage.  The tomato sauce on the side went well with the kufteta, we asked for more.    

I should have traded out the bean salad for fries topped with Bulgarian feta.  Lots of tables ordered that as a stand-alone dish.   Bulgarian feta is good stuff.  It's quite different from the popular Greek version, creamy while still being firm.  That really shines when shredded like in the shopska salad at the start of our meal.  It also tasted great when baked in a clay pot with lukanka, egg and tomato sauce.  The lukanka had a nice, lean salami and bacon taste to it.  I'd love to try their other dried meats.  The Bulgarian red wine was served cold and went well with everything.  A bottle was only $18.  Nazdrave!  
   
Got talked into the biscuit cake for dessert after some arm-twisting.....light twistin..............OK....no freaking twist at all.  She simply suggested it and we said yes.   Glad we did!  It was like a sweeter tiramisu.  

So the food definitely made up for the smokiness, but BG Bistro would not be for everyone.   Pretty cool that it's in the same plaza as Villa Algarve though.  A burgeoning international plaza!!
